intro: Elatostema seemannianum, commonly known as the small-stemmed elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom throughout the warmer months. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
